intro: Nasturtium owahiense, commonly known as the Oregon nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its vibrant orange or red flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along streambanks and in forested areas. Its flowers are often used in ornamental gardening and have a peppery taste, similar to watercress. Nasturtium owahiense is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and providing habitat for small wildlife.
